## {#diataxis-map data-menu-title="The Diátaxis Map"} 

[The Diátaxis Map]{.slide-title}

<hr>

A framework for structuring documentation into four distinct areas:

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

**Tutorials**
* Learning-oriented
* Practical steps
* Getting started

**How-to guides**
* Problem-oriented
* Series of steps
* Achieving goals

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

**Reference**
* Information-oriented
* Structured information
* Describing machinery

**Explanation**
* Understanding-oriented
* Theoretical knowledge
* Background and context

:::

::::

---

## {#diataxis-application data-menu-title="Applying Diátaxis"} 

[When do you need all four areas?]{.slide-title}

<hr>

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

**A _tool_ needs all four areas**

* Comprehensive documentation
* Multiple user types
* Different levels of expertise
* Long-term maintenance

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

**An _analysis_ probably needs a subset**

* Specific audience
* Limited scope
* Focused purpose
* Time constraints

:::

::::

<br>

**Think-pair-share:** Why might this be the case?

## {#readme-documentation data-menu-title="README Documentation"} 

[README Documentation]{.slide-title}

<hr>

**Core elements required for all MEDS-related homework assignments and projects:**

1. A short, but descriptive title 
2. A brief explanation of the repository's purpose
3. A concise description of what's housed in the repository
4. Details regarding data access
5. A list of authors or current contributors (for collaborative work)
6. References

---

## {#code-comments data-menu-title="Code Comments"} 

[Code Comments]{.slide-title}

<hr>

**Types of comments:**

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="50%"}

**Headers**
* File purpose
* Author information
* Date created/modified

**Inline**
* Explaining complex logic
* Clarifying assumptions
* Warning about edge cases

:::

::: {.column width="50%"}

**Functions**
* Parameters and their types
* Return values
* Example usage
* Side effects

:::

::::

---

[Code Style]{.slide-title}

<hr>

**Readability → Comprehension → Reproducibility**

<br>

**Consistency is key!** (Just like workflow folder organization)

<br>

**Key considerations:**
